defs: a kind of plant.
the plant Desmodium motorium (= D. gyrans) of Papilionaceae; telegraph plant.
its bean.
the plant Dolichos falcatus of Papilionaceae family.
its gram; wild horse gram.
the plant Vicia faba (= Faba vulgaris) of Papilionaceae family.
its bean; broad bean.
the creeper Clitoria ternatea of Papilionaceae family.
the creeper Luffa acutangula (var. amara) of Cucurbitaceae family; bitter luffa.
the plant Phaseolus adenanthus of Papilionaceae family.
its gram.
an undomesticated, wild cow.
a contest in which two opponents grapple and try to throw each other to the ground esp. as an athletic sport under a code of rules; wrestling.
the quality or an instance of being strong or forceful; vehemence 3) the act or an instance of struggle for superiority (with another); a vying; competition.
to turn oneself uncivilised; to become irrational.
to lose one's property; to become destitute; to go to ruin.
the act or an instance of annoying; annoyance; trouble; vexation.
a worthless game; a useless play, esp. that spoils children's education.
an untamed, wild horse.
an inhabitant of or a person habitually wanders in a forest; a forester.
a man who lives by hunting; a hunter.
an uncultured or ungentle person.
the act of wandering in a forest; inhabitation in a forest.
the quality or condition of being not cultured, refined; absence of refinement; unculturedness.
an undomesticated goat; a wild goat.
the creeper Trichosanthes cuumerina of Cucurbitaceae family.
an untamed elephant; a wild elephant.
the revenue that a government gets from forests.
cultivaion or farming depending only on rain water.
a tax on non-irrigable, but cultivable land.
an undomesticated, wild cow.
a forest dwelling woman.
an old unit of measure.
a woman of black complexion.
a manifestation of Mother Goddess Pārvati, in a black and formidable form.
= ಕಾಡೀಕಾರ.
the act of troubling or causing minor irritation; an annoying.
one who annoys, molests another or others; an annoyer.
a bird of the family Anatidae with short webbed feet, long bill; a duck.
fine soot produced by the incomplete combustion of oils and other forms of carbon; lampblack.
a medicated eye-wash; collyrium.
anything that is black.
the black earth; a black soil region.

a very thin paper coated on one side with a waxy, lampblack preparation, which is placed between two sheets of paper so that the pressure of typing or writing on the upper sheet makes a copy on the lower; a carbon paper.
a dark eye.
an eye washed with collyrium.
= ಕಾಡಿಗೆಗಣ್.
= ಕಾಡಿಗೆಗರಿಕೆ.
the weed Eclipta prostrata (= E. alba) of Asteraceae family.
= ಕಾಡಿಗೆಗರಿಕೆ.
the tip of a lamp flame emanating black smoke.
a small casket or a vessel with a lid for keeping the collyrium.
the blackish Indian millet plant (Sorghum vulghare).
its millet.
the Indian millet, in gen., the grains of which are turned black from a particular kind of disease.
the sheen or glossiness of black object.
to wash (the eye) with collyrium.
= ಕಾಡಿಗೆಯಿಡು.
any of various plant diseases, esp. of cereal grasses, characterised by the appearance of masses of black spores which usu. break up into a fine powder; smut disease.
= ಕಾಡಿಗೆಯಿಡು.
Anjanādri, the black mountain.
having eye washed with collyrum.
splendidness of black colour or black eye-wash.
the bird of passerine family known for its ingeniousness for weaving the nests; a weaver-bird.
= ಕಾಡಿಗೆಗರಿಕೆ.
= ಕಾಡಿಗೆಗರಿಕೆ.
a tree of Loganiaceae family, akin to nux-vomica; wild nux-vomica.
the tree Madhuca indica (= Bassia latifolia) of Sapotaceae family; Indian butter tree.
another tree, Madhuca longifolia (= Bassialongifolia) of the same family; honey tree.
a stick of strained, rehardened lac; shellac-stick.
= ಕಾಡಿರುವಂತಿಗೆ.
the plant Jasinum angustifolium of Oleaceae family.
its flower.
to trouble, disturb, agitate; to annoy; to vex.
a substance that exerts corroding or disintegrating action on the skin and flesh; caustic.
a solvent used by goldsmiths and makers of glass mirror, which burns the skin if contacted.
= ಕಾಡೀಕಾರ.
fermented juice made from grape or apple fruits.

its bulb; poison bulb.
the plant Urginia indica (= Scilla indica) of Liliaceae family.

to vex with importunity, jests etc.; to tease.
to trouble; to molest; to annoy.
to irritate (often, playfully).
to cause to do somehing by insistence, repeated requests or urging; to persuade (irritatingly).
an expanse of land uncultivated, covered with thick trees, shrubs etc.; a forest.
(fig.) any piece of land covered with uncultivated, undesired plants.
a piece of land fit for tillage; an arable land.
a crude or coarse taste, manner; want of culture or civility; uncivility.
(in comp.) any piece of land (as in suḍugāḍu, haḷḷigāḍu, etc.).

ಕಾಡಿನ ಬೆಳದಿಂಗಳು kāḍina beḷadingaḷu beauty, talent, merit or value that is unnoticed or unutilised; ಕಾಡಿನಲ್ಲಿ ತಿರುಗಿ ಕಟ್ಟಿಗೆ ಇಲ್ಲಾ ಅನ್ನು kāḍinalli tirugi kaṭṭige illa annu being amidst plenty, search for it; ಕಾಡಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಹುಲಿ ಕೂಗಿದರೆ ನಾಡಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಒಕ್ಕಲು ತೆಗೆದರು kāḍinalli huli kūgidare, nāḍinalli okkalu tegedaru take unreasonable precautions; ಕಾಡು ಬಾಯೆನ್ನುತ್ತಿರು, ಊರು ಹೋಗುಯೆನ್ನುತ್ತಿರು kāḍu bāyennuttiru, ūru hōgu yennuttiru to be in the last stage of one's life, hence to be not interested in worldly matters.
